elements.title: Little Amal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 3.5-metre (11 ft) puppet Little Amal (pictured) was met in Rome by Pope Francis, who took her hand?

elements.title: Epson ActionNote (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Epson ActionNote was one of the first Windows laptops with a touchpad?

elements.title: Found (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the subjects of the documentary Found discover that they are biological cousins as teenagers?

elements.title: Hulk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a cheat code for the 2003 video game Hulk is hidden in a scene of the film it is based on?

elements.title: Patchwork (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the sewing-themed board game Patchwork has been described as "devious and cutthroat"?

elements.title: 1977 Yili fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1977 Yili fire, the deadliest since the founding of the People's Republic of China, was caused by a special jumping firecracker?

elements.title: Lukman Hakim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that to print money during the Indonesian National Revolution, Lukman Hakim had to lead a group to the town of Muara Bungo to find a printing machine?

elements.title: KXGF (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one owner of Montana radio station KXGF went from owning the Plush Pillow to liquidating his assets in a span of six months?
